snippet: David Wolpe of Sinai Temple in Los Angeles says that about half the families in his synagogue, with a heavy Persian population, oppose his new policy.
abstract: Rabbi David Wolpe of Sinai Temple in Los Angeles says that about half the families in his synagogue, with a heavy Persian population, oppose his new policy that gay marriages will be performed in the congregation; argument within the congregation offers a striking contrast to newspaper and television images of gay couples across California rushing to be married.
lead_paragraph: David Wolpe of Sinai Temple in Los Angeles says that about half the families in his synagogue, with a heavy Persian population, oppose his new policy.

headline.main: Gay Marriage Stirs Rebellion at Synagogue
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage Stirs Rebellion At Synagogue

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
